document.docTitle: Telobella kemiri Suhardjono & Deharveng 2001, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Telobella kemiri, a new species of Lobellini (Collembola: Neanuridae) from Lombok island (Indonesia)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Telobella kemiri, a new species of Lobellini (Collembola: Neanuridae) from Lombok island (Indonesia)

heading.emphasis:
Description of
Telobella kemiri
new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type­material . ­
Holotype female , Indonesia : Lombok , Sesaot , hutan
Kemiri
, alt.
300 m
, litter , by hand ,
18 / 11 / 1986
, Y. R. Suhardjono leg. (sample N­04)
­
Paratypes :
26 specimens
, ibid
. Material deposited in the Museum Zoologicum Bogoriense collection (holotype,
19 paratypes
) and in the Museum National d’Histoire Naturelle de Paris (
6 paratypes
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1­7.
Telobella kemiri
n. sp.
1 ­ Labrum in ventro­distal view; 2 ­ Mandible; 3 ­ Labrum in dorsal view; 4 ­ Labium; 5 ­ Dorso­internal tubercle of abd. V; 6 ­ Tubercles De, DL and L of abd. IV showing the additional integument swelling; 7 ­ Chaetotaxy and tubercles in dorsal view

TABLE 1 . Chaetotaxy of
Telobella kemiri
n. sp.

collectingCountry.name: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology . ­ The new species was collected from leaf litter beneath
Aleurites moluccana ,
the candle nut tree, locally called “ kemiri ”.

Body length:
1100 to 1800
µm. Body flattened, wide, with the sixth abdominal tergite weakly lobed (
Fig. 7
). Colour: white in alcohol. Eyes black, small, 3 + 3 , subequal. Dorsointernal tubercles and those of the head weakly or not developed. Presence of an additional integument swelling devoid of chaetae between and behind De and DL of abd.IV (
Fig. 6
). Abd.VI not hidden by abd.V. Three kinds of ordinary dorsal chaetae: (i) and (ii), mesochaetae and microchaetae, thin and acuminate, on all parts of the body; (iii), macrochaetae, thin, straight, slightly rugose, very slightly sheathed, and blunt (
Fig. 5
), except the lateral ones which are acute apically. No plurichaetosis. S­chaetae thin, shorter than the closest macrochaetae; supernumerary S­chaeta only on lateral tubercle of abd.IV (
Fig. 7
and Table I ).

Post­cephalic chaetotaxy as in
Fig. 7
and Table I. Chaeta M present on tibiotarsus. Claw with a strong internal tooth.

Discussion. ­ The new species
T. kemiri
is the first Neanurinae cited from Lombok and the second Telobella of Indonesia . By the inclusion of the S­chaeta in the tubercle ( De +DL) on abd.V, it is close to
T. wayang .
